00040 /**
00041  * @file
00042  *
00043  * This file contains defines for the SPI interface
00044  *
00045  * <hr>$Revision: 78888 $<hr>
00046  *
00047  *
00048  */
00049 #ifndef __CVMX_SPI_H__
00050 #define __CVMX_SPI_H__
00051 
00052 #ifdef CVMX_BUILD_FOR_LINUX_KERNEL
00053 #include "cvmx-gmxx-defs.h"
00054 #endif
00055 
00056 #ifdef  __cplusplus
00057 /* *INDENT-OFF* */
00058 extern "C" {
00059 /* *INDENT-ON* */
00060 #endif
00061 
00062 /* CSR typedefs have been moved to cvmx-spi-defs.h */
00063 
00064 typedef enum {
00065     CVMX_SPI_MODE_UNKNOWN = 0,
00066     CVMX_SPI_MODE_TX_HALFPLEX = 1,
00067     CVMX_SPI_MODE_RX_HALFPLEX = 2,
00068     CVMX_SPI_MODE_DUPLEX = 3
00069 } cvmx_spi_mode_t;
00070 
00071 /** Callbacks structure to customize SPI4 initialization sequence */
00072 typedef struct {
00073     /** Called to reset SPI4 DLL */
00074     int (*reset_cb) (int interface, cvmx_spi_mode_t mode);
00075 
00076     /** Called to setup calendar */
00077     int (*calendar_setup_cb) (int interface, cvmx_spi_mode_t mode, int num_ports);
00078 
00079     /** Called for Tx and Rx clock detection */
00080     int (*clock_detect_cb) (int interface, cvmx_spi_mode_t mode, int timeout);
00081 
00082     /** Called to perform link training */
00083     int (*training_cb) (int interface, cvmx_spi_mode_t mode, int timeout);
00084 
00085     /** Called for calendar data synchronization */
00086     int (*calendar_sync_cb) (int interface, cvmx_spi_mode_t mode, int timeout);
00087 
00088     /** Called when interface is up */
00089     int (*interface_up_cb) (int interface, cvmx_spi_mode_t mode);
00090 
00091 } cvmx_spi_callbacks_t;
00092 
00093 /**
00094  * Return true if the supplied interface is configured for SPI
00095  *
00096  * @param interface Interface to check
00097  * @return True if interface is SPI
00098  */
00099 static inline int cvmx_spi_is_spi_interface(int interface)
00100 {
00101     uint64_t gmxState = cvmx_read_csr(CVMX_GMXX_INF_MODE(interface));
00102     return ((gmxState & 0x2) && (gmxState & 0x1));
00103 }
00104 
00105 /**
00106  * Initialize and start the SPI interface.
00107  *
00108  * @param interface The identifier of the packet interface to configure and
00109  *                  use as a SPI interface.
00110  * @param mode      The operating mode for the SPI interface. The interface
00111  *                  can operate as a full duplex (both Tx and Rx data paths
00112  *                  active) or as a halfplex (either the Tx data path is
00113  *                  active or the Rx data path is active, but not both).
00114  * @param timeout   Timeout to wait for clock synchronization in seconds
00115  * @param num_ports Number of SPI ports to configure
00116  *
00117  * @return Zero on success, negative of failure.
00118  */ extern int cvmx_spi_start_interface(int interface, cvmx_spi_mode_t mode, int timeout, int num_ports);
00119 
00120 /**
00121  * This routine restarts the SPI interface after it has lost synchronization
00122  * with its corespondant system.
00123  *
00124  * @param interface The identifier of the packet interface to configure and
00125  *                  use as a SPI interface.
00126  * @param mode      The operating mode for the SPI interface. The interface
00127  *                  can operate as a full duplex (both Tx and Rx data paths
00128  *                  active) or as a halfplex (either the Tx data path is
00129  *                  active or the Rx data path is active, but not both).
00130  * @param timeout   Timeout to wait for clock synchronization in seconds
00131  * @return Zero on success, negative of failure.
00132  */
00133 extern int cvmx_spi_restart_interface(int interface, cvmx_spi_mode_t mode, int timeout);
00134 
00135 /**
00136  * Return non-zero if the SPI interface has a SPI4000 attached
00137  *
00138  * @param interface SPI interface the SPI4000 is connected to
00139  *
00140  * @return
00141  */
00142 extern int cvmx_spi4000_is_present(int interface);
00143 
00144 /**
00145  * Initialize the SPI4000 for use
00146  *
00147  * @param interface SPI interface the SPI4000 is connected to
00148  */
00149 extern int cvmx_spi4000_initialize(int interface);
00150 
00151 /**
00152  * Poll all the SPI4000 port and check its speed
00153  *
00154  * @param interface Interface the SPI4000 is on
00155  * @param port      Port to poll (0-9)
00156  * @return Status of the port. 0=down. All other values the port is up.
00157  */
00158 extern cvmx_gmxx_rxx_rx_inbnd_t cvmx_spi4000_check_speed(int interface, int port);
00159 
00160 /**
00161  * Get current SPI4 initialization callbacks
00162  *
00163  * @param callbacks  Pointer to the callbacks structure.to fill
00164  *
00165  * @return Pointer to cvmx_spi_callbacks_t structure.
00166  */
00167 extern void cvmx_spi_get_callbacks(cvmx_spi_callbacks_t * callbacks);
00168 
00169 /**
00170  * Set new SPI4 initialization callbacks
00171  *
00172  * @param new_callbacks  Pointer to an updated callbacks structure.
00173  */
00174 extern void cvmx_spi_set_callbacks(cvmx_spi_callbacks_t * new_callbacks);
00175 
00176 /**
00177  * Callback to perform SPI4 reset
00178  *
00179  * @param interface The identifier of the packet interface to configure and
00180  *                  use as a SPI interface.
00181  * @param mode      The operating mode for the SPI interface. The interface
00182  *                  can operate as a full duplex (both Tx and Rx data paths
00183  *                  active) or as a halfplex (either the Tx data path is
00184  *                  active or the Rx data path is active, but not both).
00185  * @return Zero on success, non-zero error code on failure (will cause SPI initialization to abort)
00186  */
00187 extern int cvmx_spi_reset_cb(int interface, cvmx_spi_mode_t mode);
00188 
00189 /**
00190  * Callback to setup calendar and miscellaneous settings before clock detection
00191  *
00192  * @param interface The identifier of the packet interface to configure and
00193  *                  use as a SPI interface.
00194  * @param mode      The operating mode for the SPI interface. The interface
00195  *                  can operate as a full duplex (both Tx and Rx data paths
00196  *                  active) or as a halfplex (either the Tx data path is
00197  *                  active or the Rx data path is active, but not both).
00198  * @param num_ports Number of ports to configure on SPI
00199  *
00200  * @return Zero on success, non-zero error code on failure (will cause SPI initialization to abort)
00201  */
00202 extern int cvmx_spi_calendar_setup_cb(int interface, cvmx_spi_mode_t mode, int num_ports);
00203 
00204 /**
00205  * Callback to perform clock detection
00206  *
00207  * @param interface The identifier of the packet interface to configure and
00208  *                  use as a SPI interface.
00209  * @param mode      The operating mode for the SPI interface. The interface
00210  *                  can operate as a full duplex (both Tx and Rx data paths
00211  *                  active) or as a halfplex (either the Tx data path is
00212  *                  active or the Rx data path is active, but not both).
00213  * @param timeout   Timeout to wait for clock synchronization in seconds
00214  * @return Zero on success, non-zero error code on failure (will cause SPI initialization to abort)
00215  */
00216 extern int cvmx_spi_clock_detect_cb(int interface, cvmx_spi_mode_t mode, int timeout);
00217 
00218 /**
00219  * Callback to perform link training
00220  *
00221  * @param interface The identifier of the packet interface to configure and
00222  *                  use as a SPI interface.
00223  * @param mode      The operating mode for the SPI interface. The interface
00224  *                  can operate as a full duplex (both Tx and Rx data paths
00225  *                  active) or as a halfplex (either the Tx data path is
00226  *                  active or the Rx data path is active, but not both).
00227  * @param timeout   Timeout to wait for link to be trained (in seconds)
00228  * @return Zero on success, non-zero error code on failure (will cause SPI initialization to abort)
00229  */
00230 extern int cvmx_spi_training_cb(int interface, cvmx_spi_mode_t mode, int timeout);
00231 
00232 /**
00233  * Callback to perform calendar data synchronization
00234  *
00235  * @param interface The identifier of the packet interface to configure and
00236  *                  use as a SPI interface.
00237  * @param mode      The operating mode for the SPI interface. The interface
00238  *                  can operate as a full duplex (both Tx and Rx data paths
00239  *                  active) or as a halfplex (either the Tx data path is
00240  *                  active or the Rx data path is active, but not both).
00241  * @param timeout   Timeout to wait for calendar data in seconds
00242  * @return Zero on success, non-zero error code on failure (will cause SPI initialization to abort)
00243  */
00244 extern int cvmx_spi_calendar_sync_cb(int interface, cvmx_spi_mode_t mode, int timeout);
00245 
00246 /**
00247  * Callback to handle interface up
00248  *
00249  * @param interface The identifier of the packet interface to configure and
00250  *                  use as a SPI interface.
00251  * @param mode      The operating mode for the SPI interface. The interface
00252  *                  can operate as a full duplex (both Tx and Rx data paths
00253  *                  active) or as a halfplex (either the Tx data path is
00254  *                  active or the Rx data path is active, but not both).
00255  * @return Zero on success, non-zero error code on failure (will cause SPI initialization to abort)
00256  */
00257 extern int cvmx_spi_interface_up_cb(int interface, cvmx_spi_mode_t mode);

00259 #ifdef  __cplusplus
00260 /* *INDENT-OFF* */
00261 }

00263 #endif
